cardTitle: AI and Algorithms Qualification Toolkit (AI AQT)
description1: With a maximum of three questions, a well-founded assessment can be made whether a data-driven application qualifies as an AI system under the
description2: Through 4 additional questions, it can also determine whether an algorithm qualifies as a high-impact algorithm, according to the
description4: With minor added questions, Questionnaire 1B (in beta) allows for identification of solely automated decision-making (sADM), following from
description5: Using between five and thirty questions, Questionnaire 2 determines the risk category of an AI system.
description6: These dynamic questionnaires are primarily designed for public sector organizations but can also be valuable for other sectors.

disclaimer: Note: Always verify the outcomes of this tool using legal expertise, the legal text and additional relevant sources. This tool contains interpretations of complex legal definitions, as understood by Stichting Algorithm Audit. The interpretation of these definitions has not yet crystallized and many more years, additional guidance and various court cases will be needed before there is a shared universal interpretation. In addition, nuance is sometimes lost when translating legal definitions into understandable language. No rights can be derived from the outcomes of this tool.
